name: European Migraine and Headache Alliance
goal:
The European Migraine and Headache Alliance (EMHA) is a non-profit, patient umbrella group which was launched in 2006. Since then, the Alliance has grown to represent patient groups from across the continent. It is now the only umbrella organization representing patients with migraine, cluster headache and other disabling headache disorders. Each year, on September 12th, the European Migraine and Headache Alliance organizes a European Migraine Day of Action.

Type: pan-European disease-specific organization

Disease area: Headache disorders. Headache disorders are among the most common disorders of the nervous system. These include tension-type headache (TTH), migraine and chronic daily headache syndromes as well as the more rare disorders, cluster headache and trigeminal neuralgia.
interests: Communication, Consumers, Digital economy and society, Employment and Social Affairs, Food Safety, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation
euInitiatives: Health promotion, health systems, patients' rights, medicines, medical research, access to medicines, access to care, carers' rights, cross border access to treatment.
